page.title: 18NEW ABBEY - TOURISM
page.content: The picturesque village of New Abbey, attracting visitors from all over the world,is noted for the ruins of Sweetheart Abbey.It also has two churches, two hotels, a tearoom/craft shop, and a post office/general store. The 13th century abbey with the romantic story of its founder Lady Devorgilla,(see Page 14) attracts, on average, 12000 visitors a year. In 1977 Charles Stewart, the local Laird, gifted to the National Museums of Scotland his costume collection, and his family home, Shambellie House, where a different selection is displayed each summer. The Costume Museum has 10800 visitors each year. In 1979 he gifted, to the Ancient Momuments, the 19th century corn mill which was restored to working order in in 1983, and won the Civic Trust Award in 1985. It has about 6500 visitors.
